</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">



</TABLE>


<P align="right" style="font-size: 10pt">Page 13



<P>
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">5.04</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B>Withdrawals</B></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">(a)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Subject to approval by the Administrative Committee and the provisions of
paragraph (b)&nbsp;below, at any time before the total amount of a
Participant&#146;s Deferral Account is distributed from the Plan in accordance
with the foregoing provisions of this Article&nbsp;5, a Participant who is in
active service may elect to withdraw all or any fixed dollar portion of
the amount of his Deferral Account by duly completing, executing, and
filing with the Administrative Committee the appropriate form designated
by the Administrative Committee. The withdrawal payment to the
Participant shall be made in a lump sum as soon as practicable after the
Reporting Date coincident with or next following the date the
corresponding withdrawal request is duly approved by the Administrative
Committee.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">(b)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>In the event the Administrative Committee approves a Participant&#146;s
withdrawal request, then the Participant shall be subject to a forfeiture
penalty of 10&nbsp;percent of the amount of the withdrawal, unless the
Participant proves to the Compensation Committee with such evidence as the
Compensation Committee may deem appropriate that the withdrawal request is
occasioned by severe financial hardship. In the event such Participant
incurs a forfeiture penalty under this Section&nbsp;5.04(b), such amount shall
be permanently forfeited and debited from the Participant&#146;s Deferral
Account by the Company at the time the withdrawal payment is made to the
Participant, and any such amounts forfeited and debited from the
Participant&#146;s Deferral Account shall, in no event and in no manner, be
ever again credited to the individual under this Plan.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">5.05</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B>Payment upon the Occurrence of a Change of Control</B></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Notwithstanding the foregoing provisions of this Article&nbsp;5, upon the
occurrence of a Change of Control or at the direction of the Compensation
Committee, upon the approval by the Board of Directors of a corporate
event leading to a Change of Control, all Participants shall
automatically receive the balance of their Deferral Accounts in a single
lump sum payment. Such lump sum payment shall be made as soon as
practicable on or after the Change of Control. If the Participant dies
after such Change of Control, but before receiving such payment, it shall
be made to his Beneficiary.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">5.06</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B>Tax Increases</B></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Notwithstanding the provisions of Sections&nbsp;5.01 and 5.03, in the event a
Participant&#146;s Deferral Account is being paid in installment payments
under Section&nbsp;5.02, and during said payout period Federal personal income
tax rates for the highest marginal tax rate are scheduled to increase by
5 or more percentage points, at the direction of the Compensation
Committee, any remaining installment payments to be paid after the
effective date of such increase shall be paid in one lump sum prior to
said effective date.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">



</TABLE>


<P align="right" style="font-size: 10pt">Page 14



<P>
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">5.07</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B>Designation of Beneficiary</B></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Each Participant shall file with the Administrative Committee a written
designation of one or more persons as the Beneficiary who shall be
entitled to receive the amount, if any, payable under the Plan upon his
death pursuant to Section&nbsp;5.02(b) or 5.05. A Participant may, from time
to time, revoke or change his Beneficiary designation without the consent
of any prior Beneficiary by filing a new designation with the
Administrative Committee. The last such designation received by the
Administrative Committee shall be controlling; provided, however, that no
designation, or change or revocation thereof, shall be effective unless
received by the Administrative Committee prior to the Participant&#146;s
death, and in no event shall it be effective as of a date prior to such
receipt. If no such Beneficiary designation is in effect at the time of
a Participant&#146;s death, or if no designated Beneficiary survives the
Participant, the Participant&#146;s surviving spouse, if any, shall be deemed
to have been designated his Beneficiary, otherwise the Participant&#146;s
estate shall be deemed to have been designated as his Beneficiary, and
shall receive the payment of the amount, if any, payable under the Plan
upon his death.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">5.08</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B>Debiting Accounts</B></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Any amounts debited from a Participant&#146;s Deferral Account by reason of a
distribution, withdrawal, or otherwise under this Article&nbsp;5, shall be
debited from the Participant&#146;s Deferral Account and the investment
options under which such amount is credited, and such other accounts,
subaccounts, options, or other allocations in the same proportion that
the Participant&#146;s entire Deferral Account is credited at the time such
debit is made, as determined by the Administrative Committee.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><B>ARTICLE 6. AMENDMENT OR TERMINATION</B>



<P>
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">6.01</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B>Right to Terminate</B></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The Corporation may, by action of the Board of Directors, terminate this
Plan and the related Deferral Agreements at any time. In the event the
Plan and related Deferral Agreements are terminated, each Participant or
Beneficiary shall receive a single sum payment in cash equal to the
balance of the Participant&#146;s Deferral Account. The single sum payment
shall be made as soon as practicable following the date the Plan is
terminated and shall be in lieu of any other benefit which may be payable
to the Participant or Beneficiary under this Plan.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">6.02</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B>Right to Amend</B></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The Compensation Committee may amend or modify this Plan and the related
Deferral Agreements in any way either retroactively or prospectively;
provided, however, no amendment or modification shall reduce the balance
of a Participant&#146;s Deferral Account as of the date of such amendment or
modification, as adjusted pursuant to Article&nbsp;4. Notwithstanding the
foregoing, a change in any investment fund or index under Section&nbsp;4.01
shall not be deemed to adversely affect any Participant&#146;s rights to his
Deferral Account.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><B>ARTICLE 7. GENERAL PROVISIONS</B>



<P>
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">7.01</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B>Funding</B></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">(a)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>All amounts payable in accordance with this Plan shall constitute a
general unsecured obligation of the Company. Such amounts, as well as any
administrative costs relating to the Plan, shall be paid out of the
general assets of the Company, to the extent not paid by a grantor trust
established pursuant to paragraph (b)&nbsp;below. The Administrative Committee
may decide that a Participant&#146;s Account may be reduced to reflect
allocable administrative expense.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">(b)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The Corporation may, for administrative reasons, establish a grantor
trust for the benefit of Participants participating in the Plan. The
assets of said trust will be held separate and apart from other
Corporation funds, and shall be used exclusively for the purposes set
forth in the Plan and the applicable trust agreement, subject to the
following conditions:</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>


<P>
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="6%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">(i)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>the creation of said trust shall not cause the Plan to be
other than &#147;unfunded&#148; for purposes of Title I of ERISA;</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="6%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">(ii)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>the Corporation shall be treated as &#147;grantor&#148; of said trust
for purposes of Code Section&nbsp;677; and</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="6%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">(iii)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>said trust agreement shall provide that its assets may be
used to satisfy claims of the Corporation&#146;s general creditors, and
the rights of such general creditors are enforceable by them under
federal and state law.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>


<P>
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">7.02</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B>No Contract of Employment</B></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The Plan is not a contract of employment and the terms of employment of
any Participant shall not be affected in any way by this Plan or related
instruments, except as specifically provided therein. The establishment
of the Plan shall not be construed as conferring any legal rights upon
any person for a continuation of employment, nor shall it interfere with
the rights of the Company to discharge any person and to treat him
without regard to the effect which such treatment might have upon him
under this Plan. Each Participant and all persons who may have or claim
any right by reason of his participation shall be bound by the terms of
this Plan and all Deferral Agreements entered into pursuant thereto.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">7.03</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B>Unsecured Interest</B></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Neither the Company nor the Compensation Committee nor the Administrative
Committee in any way guarantees the performance of the investment funds
or indices a Participant may designate under Article&nbsp;4. No special or
separate fund shall be established, and no segregation of assets shall be
made, to assure the payments thereunder. No Participant</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">



</TABLE>


<P align="right" style="font-size: 10pt">Page 17



<P>
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>hereunder shall have any right, title, or interest whatsoever in any
specific assets of the Company. Nothing contained in this Plan and no
action taken pursuant to its provisions shall create or be construed to
create a trust of any kind or a fiduciary relationship between the
Company and a Participant or any other person. To the extent that any
person acquires a right to receive payments under this Plan, such right
shall be no greater than the right of any unsecured creditor of the
Company.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">7.04</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B>Facility of Payment</B></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>In the event that the Administrative Committee shall find that a
Participant or Beneficiary is unable to care for his affairs because of
illness or accident or is a minor or has died, the Administrative
Committee may direct that any benefit payment due him, unless claim shall
have been made therefor by a duly appointed legal representative, be paid
on his behalf to his spouse, a child, a parent or other blood relative,
and any such payment so made shall thereby be a complete discharge of the
liability of the Plan for that payment.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">7.05</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B>Withholding Taxes</B></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The Company shall have the right to deduct from each payment to be made
under the Plan any required withholding taxes.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">7.06</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B>Nonalienation</B></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Subject to any applicable law, no benefit under the Plan shall be subject
in any manner to anticipation, alienation, sale, transfer, assignment,
pledge, encumbrance or charge, and any attempt to do so shall be void,
nor shall any such benefit be in any manner liable for or subject to
garnishment, attachment, execution or levy, or liable for or subject to
the debts, contracts, liabilities, engagements or torts of a person
entitled to such benefits.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">7.07</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B>Mergers/Transfers</B></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>This Plan shall be binding upon and inure to the benefit of the Company
and its successors and assignees and the Participant, his designees and
his estate. Nothing in this Plan shall preclude the Company from
consolidating or merging into or with, or transferring all or
substantially all of its assets to, another corporation which assumes
this Plan and all obligations of the Company hereunder. Upon such a
consolidation, merger or transfer of assets and
assumption, the term &#147;Company&#148; shall refer to such other corporation and
this Plan shall continue in full force and effect.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">7.08</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B>Limitation of Liability</B></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The Company, the members of the Compensation Committee and of the
Administrative Committee, and any officer, employee or agent of the
Company shall not incur any liability</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">



</TABLE>


<P align="right" style="font-size: 10pt">Page 18



<P>
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>individually or on behalf of any other individuals or on behalf of the
Company for any act or failure to act, made in good faith in relation to
this Plan.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">7.09</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B>Indemnification</B></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The Company, the members of the Compensation Committee and of the
Administrative Committee, and the officers, employees and agents of the
Company shall, unless prohibited by any applicable law, be indemnified
against any and all liabilities arising by reason of any act or failure
to act in relation to the Plan including, without limitation, expenses
reasonably incurred in the defense of any claim relating to the Plan,
amounts paid in any compromise or settlement relating to the Plan and any
civil penalty or excise tax imposed by any applicable statute, if:</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P>
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="6%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">(a)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>the act or failure to act shall have occurred</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>


<P>
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="9%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">(i)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>in the course of the person&#146;s service as an
officer, employee or agent of the Company or as a member of
the Compensation Committee or of the Administrative
Committee,</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="9%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">(ii)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>in connection with a service provided with or
without charge to the Plan or to the Participants or
Beneficiaries of the Plan, if such service was requested by
the Compensation Committee or the Administrative Committee;
and</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>


<P>
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="6%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">(b)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>the act or failure to act is in good faith and in, or not
opposed to, the best interests of the Company.</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P>
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">
<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>This determination shall be made by the Corporation and, if such
determination is made in good faith and not arbitrarily or capriciously,
shall be conclusive.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The foregoing indemnification shall be from the assets of the Company.
However, the Company&#146;s obligation hereunder shall be offset to the extent
of any otherwise applicable insurance coverage under a policy maintained
by the Company or any other person, or other source of indemnification.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">7.10</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B>Claims Procedure</B></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">(a)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B>Submission of Claims</B></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Claims for benefits under the Plan shall be submitted in writing to the
Administrative Committee or to an individual designated by the
Administrative Committee for this purpose.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">



</TABLE>


<P align="right" style="font-size: 10pt">Page 19



<P>
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">(b)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B>Denial of Claim</B></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>If any claim for benefits is wholly or partially denied, the claimant
shall be given written notice within 90&nbsp;days following the date on which
the claim is filed, which notice shall set forth the following:</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>


<P>
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="6%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">(i)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>the specific reason or reasons for the denial;</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="6%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">(ii)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>specific reference to pertinent Plan provisions on which the
denial is based;</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="6%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">(iii)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>a description of any additional material or information
necessary for the claimant to perfect the claim and an explanation
of why such material or information is necessary; and</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="6%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">(iv)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>an explanation of the Plan&#146;s claim review procedure.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>


<P>
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>If special circumstances require an extension of time for processing the
claim, written notice of an extension shall be furnished to the claimant
prior to the end of the initial period of 90&nbsp;days following the date on
which the claim is filed. Such an extension may not exceed a period of
90&nbsp;days beyond the end of said initial period.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>If the claim has not been granted and written notice of the denial of the
claim is not furnished within 90&nbsp;days following the date on which the
claim is filed, the claim shall be deemed denied for the purpose of
proceeding to the claim review procedure.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">(c)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B>Claim Review Procedure</B></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The claimant or his authorized representative shall have 60&nbsp;days after
the earlier of (i)&nbsp;receipt of written notification of denial of a claim
or (ii)&nbsp;expiration of the 90-day period (or any extended period up to 180
days pursuant to Section&nbsp;7.10(b)) following the date on which the claim
is filed, to request a review of the denial by making written request to
the Administrative Committee, and may review pertinent documents and
submit issues and comments in writing within such 60-day period.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Not later than 60&nbsp;days after receipt of the request for review, the
Administrative Committee shall render and furnish to the claimant a
written decision, which shall include specific reasons for the decision
and shall make specific references to pertinent Plan provisions on which
it is based. If special circumstances require an extension of time for
processing, the decision shall be rendered as soon as
possible, but not later than 120&nbsp;days after receipt of the request for
review, provided that written notice and explanation of the delay are
given to the claimant prior to commencement of the extension. Such
decision by the Administrative Committee shall not be subject to further
review. If a decision on review is not furnished to a claimant within
the specified time period, the claim shall be deemed to have been denied
on review.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">



</TABLE>


<P align="right" style="font-size: 10pt">Page 20



<P>
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">(d)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B>Exhaustion of Remedy</B></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>No claimant shall institute any action or proceeding in any state or
federal court of law or equity or before any administrative tribunal or
arbitrator for a claim for benefits under the Plan until the claimant has
first exhausted the procedures set forth in this Section.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">7.11</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B>Acceleration of Payment</B></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Notwithstanding any other provision of the Plan to the contrary, the
Company shall make payments hereunder to a Participant before such
payments are otherwise due if it determines, based on a change in the tax
or revenue laws of the United States of America, a published ruling or
similar announcement issued by the Internal Revenue Service, a regulation
issued by the Secretary of the Treasury or his delegate, a decision by a
court of competent jurisdiction involving a Participant or Beneficiary,
or a closing agreement made under Code Section&nbsp;7121 that is approved by
the Internal Revenue Service and involves a Participant or Beneficiary,
that a Participant or Beneficiary has recognized or will recognize income
for federal income tax purposes with respect to amounts that are or will
be payable to him under the Plan before they are paid to him.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">7.12</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B>Payment of Expenses</B></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>All administrative expenses of the Plan and all benefits under the Plan
shall be paid from the general assets of the Company, except as otherwise
may be provided herein.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">7.13</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B>Construction</B></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">(a)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The Plan is intended to constitute an unfunded deferred compensation
arrangement for a select group of management or highly compensated
employees and therefore exempt from the requirements of parts 2, 3 and 4
of Subtitle B of Title I of ERISA (pursuant to Sections&nbsp;201(2), 301(a)(3)
and 401(a)(1) of ERISA), and all rights hereunder shall be governed by
ERISA. Subject to the preceding sentence, the Plan shall be construed,
regulated and administered in accordance with the laws of the State of New
York, subject to the provisions of applicable federal laws.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">(b)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The masculine pronoun shall mean the feminine wherever appropriate.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">(c)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The illegality of any particular provision of this document shall not
affect the other provisions, and the document shall be construed in all
respects as if such invalid provision were omitted.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">(d)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Article or Section references herein shall mean references to such
Articles or Sections as contained herein, unless otherwise indicated.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV align="left">
<A name="130"></A>
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><B>ARTICLE 8. ADMINISTRATION</B>



<P>
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD colspan="2">8.01</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">(a)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The Administrative Committee shall have the exclusive responsibility and
complete discretionary authority to control the operation, management and
administration of the Plan, with all powers necessary to enable it to
properly carry out such responsibilities, including, but not limited to,
the power to interpret the Plan and any related documents, to establish
procedures for making any elections called for under the Plan, to make
factual determinations regarding any and all matters arising hereunder,
including, but not limited to, the right to determine eligibility for
benefits, the right to construe the terms of the Plan, the right to remedy
possible ambiguities, inequities, inconsistencies or omissions, and the
right to resolve all interpretive, equitable or other questions arising
under the Plan. The decisions of the Administrative Committee on all
matters shall be final, binding and conclusive on all persons to the
extent permitted by law. The Administrative Committee may appoint one or
more individuals and delegate such of its power and duties described
herein as it deems desirable to any such individuals as to any matter
within the jurisdiction of such delegations.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">(b)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>To the extent permitted by law, all agents and representatives of the
Administrative Committee shall be indemnified by the Company and saved
harmless against any claims and the expenses of defending against such
claims, resulting from any action or conduct relating to the
administration of the Plan, except claims arising from gross negligence,
willful neglect or willful misconduct.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;
</DIV>

1st&nbsp;day of September, 1998.

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt"><B>Exhibit&nbsp;13.1</B>



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt"><B>SELECTED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL DATA</B>



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The selected consolidated financial data of Barnes &#038; Noble, Inc. and its
subsidiaries (collectively, the Company) set forth on the following pages
should be read in conjunction with the consolidated financial statements and
notes included elsewhere in this report. The Company&#146;s fiscal year is comprised
of 52 or 53&nbsp;weeks, ending on the Saturday closest to the last day of January.
The Statement of Operations Data for the 52&nbsp;weeks ended January&nbsp;31, 2004
(fiscal 2003), 52&nbsp;weeks ended February&nbsp;1, 2003 (fiscal 2002) and 52&nbsp;weeks ended
February&nbsp;2, 2002 (fiscal 2001) and the Balance Sheet Data as of January&nbsp;31,
2004 and February&nbsp;1, 2003 are derived from, and are qualified by reference to,
audited consolidated financial statements which are included elsewhere in this
report. The Statement of Operations Data for the 53&nbsp;weeks ended February&nbsp;3,
2001 (fiscal 2000) and 52&nbsp;weeks ended January&nbsp;29, 2000 (fiscal 1999) and the
Balance Sheet Data as of February&nbsp;2, 2002, February&nbsp;3, 2001 and January&nbsp;29,
2000 are derived from audited consolidated financial statements not included in
this report. Certain prior-period amounts have been reclassified for
comparative purposes.

<DIV align="center">

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">F-3
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">



</TABLE>


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt"><B>MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF
OPERATIONS</B>



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company&#146;s fiscal year is comprised of 52 or 53&nbsp;weeks, ending on the
Saturday closest to the last day of January. As used in this section, &#147;fiscal
2004&#148; represents the 52&nbsp;weeks ending January&nbsp;29, 2005, &#147;fiscal 2003&#148; represents
the 52&nbsp;weeks ended January&nbsp;31, 2004, &#147;fiscal 2002&#148; represents the 52&nbsp;weeks
ended February&nbsp;1, 2003 and &#147;fiscal 2001&#148; represents the 52&nbsp;weeks ended February
2, 2002.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt"><B>General</B>



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Barnes &#038; Noble, Inc. (Barnes &#038; Noble or the Company), the nation&#146;s largest
bookseller<SUP>1</SUP>, as of January&nbsp;31, 2004 operates 842 bookstores and 1,514
video-game and entertainment-software stores. Of the 842 bookstores, 647
operate primarily under the Barnes &#038; Noble Booksellers trade name (31 of which
were opened in fiscal 2003) and 195 operate primarily under the B. Dalton
Bookseller trade name. Through its approximate 73&nbsp;percent economic interest in
barnesandnoble.com llc (Barnes &#038; Noble.com), the Company is one of the largest
sellers of books on the Internet. Through its acquisition of Sterling
Publishing Co., Inc. (Sterling), the Company is one of the top 25 publishers in
the nation and the industry&#146;s leading publisher of how-to books. The Company,
as of January&nbsp;31, 2004, has an approximate 64&nbsp;percent economic interest in
GameStop Corp., the nation&#146;s largest video-game and PC-entertainment software
specialty retailer<SUP>2</SUP>, operating 1,514 video-game and entertainment-software
stores primarily under the GameStop trade name, a Web site (www.gamestop.com),
and publishes <I>Game Informer</I>, the industry&#146;s largest circulated multi-platform
video-game magazine, with circulation of more than 1.5&nbsp;million paid
subscriptions. The Company employed approximately 56,000 full- and part-time
employees as of January&nbsp;31, 2004.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Barnes
&#038; Noble is the nation&#146;s largest operator of
bookstores<SUP>1</SUP> with 647
Barnes &#038; Noble stores located in 49 states and the District of Columbia as of
January&nbsp;31, 2004. With more than 35&nbsp;years of bookselling experience, management
has a strong sense of customers&#146; changing needs and the Company leads book
retailing with a &#147;community store&#148; concept. Barnes &#038; Noble&#146;s typical store
offers a comprehensive title base, a caf&#233;, a children&#146;s section, a music
department, a magazine section and a calendar of ongoing events, including
author appearances and children&#146;s activities, that make each Barnes &#038; Noble
store an active part of its community.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Barnes &#038; Noble stores range in size from 10,000 to 60,000 square feet
depending upon market size, and each store features an authoritative selection
of books, ranging from 60,000 to 200,000 titles. The comprehensive title
selection is diverse and reflects local interests. In addition, Barnes &#038; Noble
emphasizes books published by small and independent publishers and university
presses. Bestsellers typically represent between three and five percent of
Barnes &#038; Noble store sales. Complementing this extensive on-site selection, all
Barnes &#038; Noble stores provide customers with access to the millions of books
available to online shoppers while offering an option to have the book sent to
the store or shipped directly to the customer. All Barnes &#038; Noble stores are
equipped with its proprietary BookMaster in-store operating system, which
enhances the Company&#146;s merchandise-replenishment system, resulting in high
in-stock positions and productivity at the store level through efficiencies in
receiving, cashiering and returns processing.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During fiscal 2003, the Company added 0.6&nbsp;million square feet to the
Barnes &#038; Noble store base, bringing the total square footage to 15.8&nbsp;million
square feet, a four percent increase over the prior year. Barnes &#038; Noble stores
contributed approximately 88&nbsp;percent of the Company&#146;s total book sales in
fiscal


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt"><HR size="1" noshade width="15%" align="left">



<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right"><SUP>1</SUP></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Based upon sales reported in trade publications and public filings.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right"><SUP>2</SUP></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Based on the number of United States stores operated by GameStop and its
total United States revenues.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">F-4
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">



</TABLE>

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">2003. The Company plans to open between 30 and 35 Barnes &#038; Noble stores in
fiscal 2004, which are expected to average 26,000 square feet in size.



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At the end of fiscal 2003, the Company operated 195 B. Dalton bookstores
in 44 states and the District of Columbia. B. Dalton bookstores employ
merchandising strategies that target the mainstream consumer book market,
offering a wide range of bestsellers and general-interest titles. Most B.
Dalton bookstores range in size from 2,000 to 6,000 square feet, and while they
are appropriate to the size of adjacent mall tenants, the opening of book
superstores in nearby locations continues to have a significant adverse impact
on B. Dalton bookstores.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company is continuing to execute a strategy to maximize returns from
its B. Dalton bookstores in response to declining sales attributable primarily
to book superstore competition. Part of the Company&#146;s strategy has been to
close underperforming stores, which has resulted in the closing of 772 B.
Dalton bookstores since 1989.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On September&nbsp;15, 2003, the Company completed its acquisition of all of
Bertelsmann AG&#146;s (Bertelsmann) interest in Barnes &#038; Noble.com. As a result of
the acquisition, the Company increased its economic interest in Barnes &#038;
Noble.com from approximately 38&nbsp;percent to approximately 75&nbsp;percent. Subsequent
to the purchase, Barnes &#038; Noble.com employees exercised 3.9&nbsp;million stock
options thereby reducing the Company&#146;s economic interest in Barnes &#038; Noble.com
to approximately 73&nbsp;percent. On January&nbsp;8, 2004, the Company entered into a
merger agreement with barnesandnoble.com inc. (bn.com), the holding company
whose sole asset is its approximate 30&nbsp;percent interest in Barnes &#038; Noble.com
and whose sole business is acting as sole manager of Barnes &#038; Noble.com. Upon
consummation of the merger, Barnes &#038; Noble.com will become a wholly owned
subsidiary of the Company. The closing of the merger is expected to occur
during the second quarter of fiscal 2004.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Barnes &#038; Noble.com is a leading Internet-based retailer of books, music,
DVD/video and online courses. Since opening its online store (www.bn.com) in
March&nbsp;1997, Barnes &#038; Noble.com has attracted more than 17&nbsp;million customers in
230 countries. Barnes &#038; Noble.com&#146;s bookstore includes the largest in-stock
selection of in-print book titles with access to approximately one million
titles for immediate delivery, supplemented by more than 30&nbsp;million listings
from its nationwide network of out-of-print, rare and used book dealers. Barnes
&#038; Noble.com offers its customers fast delivery, easy and secure ordering and
rich editorial content.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;According to comScore Media Metrix, in December&nbsp;2003, Barnes &#038; Noble.com&#146;s
Web site was the eleventh most-trafficked shopping site and was among the top
65 largest Web properties on the Internet. Co-marketing agreements with major
Web portals such as America Online, Google<SUP>TM</SUP> and Microsoft Network as well as
content sites have extended Barnes &#038; Noble.com&#146;s brand recognition and
increased consumer exposure to its site. Barnes &#038; Noble.com has also
established a network of remote virtual storefronts across the Internet by
creating direct links with more than 189,000 affiliate Web sites.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Barnes &#038; Noble further differentiates its product offerings from those of
its competitors by publishing books under its own imprints. The Company,
through its January&nbsp;2003 acquisition of Sterling, is one of the top 25
publishers in the nation and the industry&#146;s leading publisher of how-to books.
Sterling has an active list of more than 4,500 owned and distributed titles,
and publishes and distributes more than 1,000 new titles annually. As the
leading publisher of how-to books, Sterling has particular strength in art
technique, gardening, cooking, health, crafts, puzzle and game, woodworking,
and house and home. With the addition of the Sterling titles, the Company has
publishing or distribution rights to nearly 10,000 titles and offers customers
high quality books at exceptional values, while


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">F-5
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">
<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">generating attractive gross margins.



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company acquired Babbage&#146;s Etc. and Funco, Inc. in October&nbsp;1999 and
June&nbsp;2000, respectively. Through a corporate restructuring, Babbage&#146;s Etc.
became a wholly owned subsidiary of Funco, Inc. and the name of Funco, Inc. was
changed to GameStop, Inc. In February&nbsp;2002, the Company completed an initial
public offering (IPO) for its GameStop subsidiary. The Company retained an
approximate 63&nbsp;percent interest in GameStop. GameStop is the nation&#146;s largest
video-game and PC-entertainment software specialty retailer, based on the
number of United States (U.S.) stores operated by GameStop and its total U.S.
revenues. As of January&nbsp;31, 2004, GameStop operates 1,514 video-game and
entertainment-software stores located in 49 states, the District of Columbia,
Ireland, Puerto Rico and Guam, primarily under the GameStop trade name. The
video-game and entertainment-software stores range in size from 500 to 5,000
square feet (averaging 1,500 square feet) depending upon market demographics.
Stores feature video-game hardware and software, PC-entertainment software and
a multitude of accessories. GameStop also operates a Web site
(www.gamestop.com), and publishes <I>Game Informer </I>magazine (collectively,
GameStop).


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt"><B>Critical Accounting Policies</B>



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of
Operations discusses the Company&#146;s consolidated financial statements, which
have been prepared in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted
in the United States. The preparation of these financial statements require
management to make estimates and assumptions in certain circumstances that
affect amounts reported in the accompanying consolidated financial statements
and related footnotes. In preparing these financial statements, management has
made its best estimates and judgments of certain amounts included in the
financial statements, giving due consideration to materiality. The Company does
not believe there is a great likelihood that materially different amounts would
be reported related to the accounting policies described below. However,
application of these accounting policies involves the exercise of judgment and
use of assumptions as to future uncertainties and, as a result, actual results
could differ from these estimates.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt"><I>Other Long-Lived Assets</I>



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company&#146;s other long-lived assets include property and equipment and
amortizable intangibles. At January&nbsp;31, 2004, the Company had $686.6&nbsp;million
of property and equipment, net of accumulated depreciation, and $20.2&nbsp;million
of amortizable intangible assets, net of amortization, accounting for
approximately 20.2% of the Company&#146;s total assets. The Company reviews its
long-lived assets for impairment whenever events or changes in circumstances
indicate that the carrying amount of an asset may not be recoverable in
accordance with Statement of Financial Accounting Standards (SFAS)&nbsp;No.&nbsp;144,
&#147;Accounting for the Impairment or Disposal of Long-Lived Assets&#148;.
Recoverability of assets held and used are measured by a comparison of the
carrying amount of an asset to undiscounted pre-tax future net cash flows.
Future events could cause the Company to conclude that impairment indicators
exist and that long-lived assets may be impaired. Any resulting impairment loss
could have a material adverse impact on the Company&#146;s financial condition and
results of operations.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt"><I>Goodwill and Unamortizable Intangible Assets</I>



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At January&nbsp;31, 2004, the Company had $509.2&nbsp;million of goodwill and $74.4
million of unamortizable intangible assets (i.e. those with an indefinite
useful life), accounting for approximately


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">F-6
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">
<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">16.6% of the Company&#146;s total assets. SFAS No.&nbsp;142, &#147;Goodwill and Other
Intangible Assets&#148;, requires that goodwill and other unamortizable intangible
assets no longer be amortized, but instead be tested for impairment at least
annually or earlier if there are impairment indicators. The Company performs a
two-step process for impairment testing of goodwill as required by SFAS No.
142. The first step of this test, used to identify potential impairment,
compares the fair value of a reporting unit with its carrying amount. The
second step (if necessary) measures the amount of the impairment. The Company
completed its annual impairment test on the goodwill in November&nbsp;2003 and
deemed that no impairment charge was necessary. The Company has noted no
subsequent indicators of impairment. The Company tests unamortizable intangible
assets by comparing the fair value and the carrying value of such assets.
Changes in market conditions, among other factors, could have a material impact
on these estimates.



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt"><I>Closed Store Expenses</I>



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;When the Company closes or relocates a store, the Company charges
unrecoverable costs to expense. Such costs include the net book value of
abandoned fixtures and leasehold improvements and, when a store is closed, a
provision for future lease obligations, net of expected sublease recoveries.
Costs associated with store closings of $6.0&nbsp;million, $10.1&nbsp;million and $9.8
million during fiscal 2003, 2002 and 2001, respectively, are included in
selling and administrative expenses in the accompanying consolidated statements
of operations.

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">F-8
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<P>
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">(1)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Fiscal 2002 operating profit is net of a
non-cash impairment charge of $25,328. Fiscal
2001 operating profit is net of legal and
settlement expenses of $4,500.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>


<P>
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right">(2)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Comparable store sales for Barnes &#038; Noble stores
are determined using stores open at least 15
months, due to the high sales volume associated
with grand openings. Comparable store sales for
B. Dalton and GameStop stores are determined
using stores open at least 12&nbsp;months.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">F-9

</DIV>



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt"><B>52 Weeks Ended January&nbsp;31, 2004 Compared with 52 Weeks</B><BR>
<B>Ended February&nbsp;1, 2003</B>



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt"><I>Sales</I>



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company&#146;s sales increased $681.7&nbsp;million, or 12.9%, during fiscal 2003
to $5.951&nbsp;billion from $5.269&nbsp;billion during fiscal 2002. This increase was
attributable to a $455.7&nbsp;million increase in book operating segment sales and
an increase of $226.0&nbsp;million from the video game operating segment sales.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The increase in book operating segment sales was primarily attributable to
a $285.4&nbsp;million increase in sales at Barnes &#038; Noble stores and the inclusion
of $151.2&nbsp;million in sales due to the consolidation of Barnes &#038; Noble.com&#146;s
results from September&nbsp;15, 2003, the date the Company acquired a controlling
interest in Barnes &#038; Noble.com. Barnes &#038; Noble store sales increased $285.4
million, or 8.0%, during 2003 to $3.860&nbsp;billion from $3.575&nbsp;billion during
fiscal 2002 and accounted for 64.9% of total Company sales or 88.3% of total
book sales. The 8.0% increase in Barnes &#038; Noble store sales was attributable to
an increase in comparable store sales of 3.2% coupled with the opening of 31
new stores during fiscal 2003, which contributed to a 4.0% increase in square
footage. This increase was partially offset by declining sales of B. Dalton,
due to 63 store closings and a comparable store sales decline of (2.0%) in
fiscal 2003.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Video game operating segment sales during fiscal 2003 increased 16.7% to
$1.579&nbsp;billion from $1.353&nbsp;billion during fiscal 2002. This increase in sales
was primarily attributable to the 300 new GameStop stores opened during fiscal
2003.


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">F-10
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt"><I>Cost of Sales and Occupancy</I>



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company&#146;s cost of sales and occupancy includes costs such as rental
expense, common area maintenance, merchant association dues and lease-required
advertising.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Cost of sales and occupancy increased $476.3&nbsp;million, or 12.4%, to $4.324
billion in fiscal 2003 from $3.847&nbsp;billion in fiscal 2002, partially due to the
inclusion of Barnes &#038; Noble.com&#146;s cost of sales and occupancy since September
15, 2003. As a percentage of sales, cost of sales and occupancy decreased to
72.7% in fiscal 2003 from 73.0% in fiscal 2002. This decrease was primarily
attributable to higher gross margins in the video game operating segment.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt"><I>Selling and Administrative Expenses</I>



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Selling and administrative expenses increased $151.1&nbsp;million, or 15.5%, to
$1,124.6&nbsp;million in fiscal 2003 from $973.5&nbsp;million in fiscal 2002. As a
percentage of sales, selling and administrative expenses increased to 18.9% in
fiscal 2003 from 18.5% in fiscal 2002. This increase was primarily attributable
to the video game operating segment.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt"><I>Depreciation and Amortization</I>



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Depreciation and amortization increased $14.9&nbsp;million, or 10.0%, to $163.6
million in fiscal 2003 from $148.7&nbsp;million in fiscal 2002. The increase was
primarily the result of the increase in depreciation related to the 300 new
GameStop stores opened during fiscal 2003 and the inclusion of Barnes &#038;
Noble.com&#146;s depreciation since September&nbsp;15, 2003.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt"><I>Pre-Opening Expenses</I>



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Pre-opening expenses decreased in fiscal 2003 to $8.8&nbsp;million from $10.2
million in fiscal 2002. The decrease in pre-opening expenses was primarily the
result of opening 31 new Barnes &#038; Noble stores during fiscal 2003, compared
with 47 new Barnes &#038; Noble stores during fiscal 2002. This decrease was
partially offset by the pre-opening expenses related to the opening of 300 new
GameStop stores during fiscal 2003 compared with 210 new GameStop stores during
fiscal 2002.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt"><I>Impairment Charge</I>



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During the first quarter of fiscal 2002, the Company deemed the decline in
value in its available-for-sale securities in Gemstar-TV Guide International,
Inc. (Gemstar) and Indigo Books &#038; Music Inc. (Indigo) to be other than
temporary. The investments had been carried at fair market value with
unrealized gains and losses included in shareholders&#146; equity. The Company
recorded a non-cash impairment charge to operating earnings of $25.3&nbsp;million
($14.9&nbsp;million after taxes) to reclassify the accumulated unrealized losses and
to write down the investments to their current fair market value at the close
of business on May&nbsp;4, 2002. The investment in Gemstar was sold in the second
quarter of fiscal 2002.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt"><I>Operating Profit</I>



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company&#146;s consolidated operating profit increased $66.2&nbsp;million, or
25.1%, to $330.3


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">F-11
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">
<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">million in fiscal 2003 from $264.1&nbsp;million in fiscal 2002. Operating
profit increased $40.9&nbsp;million, or 14.1%, in fiscal 2003 before the effect of
the $25.3&nbsp;million impairment charge during fiscal 2002.



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt"><I>Interest Expense, Net and Amortization of Deferred Financing Fees</I>



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Interest expense, net of interest income, and amortization of deferred
financing fees, decreased $1.4&nbsp;million, or 6.4%, to $20.1&nbsp;million in fiscal
2003 from $21.5&nbsp;million in fiscal 2002. The decrease was primarily the result
of reduced average borrowings under the Company&#146;s senior credit facility due to
effective working capital management.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Equity in Net Loss of Barnes &#038; Noble.com</I>


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company accounted for its approximate 38&nbsp;percent economic interest in
Barnes &#038; Noble.com under the equity method through September&nbsp;15, 2003. Equity
losses in Barnes &#038; Noble.com were $14.3&nbsp;million and $26.8&nbsp;million in fiscal
2003 and 2002, respectively.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt"><I>Other Expense</I>



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In fiscal 2002, the Company determined that a decrease in value in certain
of its equity investments occurred which was other than temporary. As a
result, other expense of $16.5&nbsp;million during fiscal 2002 included the
recognition of losses of $11.5&nbsp;million in excess of what would otherwise have
been recognized by application of the equity method in accordance with
Accounting Principles Board Opinion No.&nbsp;18, &#147;The Equity Method of Accounting
for Investments in Common Stock&#148;. The $16.5&nbsp;million loss in other expense was
primarily comprised of $8.5&nbsp;million attributable to iUniverse.com, $5.1&nbsp;million
attributable to <I>BOOK&#174; </I>magazine and $2.4&nbsp;million attributable to enews, inc.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt"><I>Income Taxes</I>



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Barnes &#038; Noble&#146;s effective tax rate in fiscal 2003 increased to 40.75
percent compared with 40.25&nbsp;percent during fiscal 2002.


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">F-12
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt"><I>Minority Interest</I>



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">Minority interest was $23.4&nbsp;million in fiscal 2003 compared with $19.1&nbsp;million
in fiscal 2002, and relates primarily to GameStop.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt"><I>Earnings</I>



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As a result of the factors discussed above, the Company reported
consolidated net earnings of $151.9&nbsp;million (or $2.07 per share) during fiscal
2003 compared with net earnings of $99.9&nbsp;million (or $1.39 per share) during
fiscal 2002. Components of diluted earnings per share are as follows:
